workflow.name: Send Rapiwa WhatsApp apology & reorder link when Shopify order is cancelled
workflow.description:
# Who Is This For?
This **n8n workflow** listens for order cancellations in Shopify, extracts relevant customer and order data, checks if the customer‚Äôs phone number is registered on WhatsApp via the **Rapiwa API**, and sends a personalised apology message with a re-order link. It also logs successful and unsuccessful attempts in **Google Sheets** for tracking.

## What This Workflow Does
- Listens for cancelled orders in your Shopify store  
- Extracts customer details and order information  
- Generates a personalised apology message including a reorder link  
- Sends the message to customers via WhatsApp using a messaging API (e.g., Twilio or Rapiwa)  
- Logs the communication results for tracking purposes  

## Key Features
- **Real-Time Cancellation Detection:** Automatically triggers when an order is cancelled  
- **Personalised Messaging:** Includes customer name, order details, and a direct reorder link  
- **WhatsApp Integration:** Sends messages via WhatsApp for higher engagement  
- **Error Handling:** Logs successful and failed message deliveries  
- **Reorder Link:** Provides a convenient link for customers to reorder with one click  

## Requirements
- n8n instance with nodes: Shopify Trigger, HTTP Request (for WhatsApp API), Code, Google Sheets (optional)  
- Shopify store with API access  
- WhatsApp messaging provider account with API access  
- Valid customer phone numbers stored in Shopify orders  

## How to Use ‚Äî Step-by-Step Setup
1. **Credentials Setup**  
   - Shopify API: Configure Shopify API credentials in n8n to listen for order cancellations  
   - WhatsApp API: Set up WhatsApp messaging credentials (e.g., Twilio, Rapiwa, or any supported provider)  
   - Google Sheets (Optional): Configure Google Sheets OAuth2 if you want to log communications  

3. **Configure Trigger**  
   Set the workflow to trigger on Shopify order cancellation events  

4. **Customize Message Content**  
   Modify the apology message template to include your store branding and tone  
   Ensure the reorder link dynamically includes the customer's cancelled order info  

5. **Set Up WhatsApp Node**  
   Connect your WhatsApp API credentials  
   Ensure the phone numbers are formatted correctly for WhatsApp delivery  



## Google Sheet Required Columns
You‚Äôll need two Google Sheets (or two tabs in one spreadsheet):
**A Google Sheet formatted like this** ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12zMJod9s3Ov0RZh-7-ZoqTvJr4yMIqOeAQKTBeZlrRk/edit?usp=sharing)
The workflow uses a Google Sheet with the following columns to track coupon distribution:

| **Name**       | **Number**    | **Email**  | **Address**       | **Price**   | **Title**      | **Re-order Link**        | **Validity** | **Status** |
| -------------- | ------------- | --------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- | ----------- | -------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------ | ---------- |
| Abdul Mannan         | 8801322827799 | [contact@spagreen.net](mailto:contact@spagreen.net) | Dhaka, Bangladesh | BDT 1955.00 | Pakistani Lawn | [Link üîó](https://yourdomain.myshopify.com/94xxxxxx32ecd063) | unverified   | not sent   |
| Abdul Mannan         | 8801322827799 | [contact@spagreen.net](mailto:contact@spagreen.net) | Dhaka, Bangladesh | BDT 1955.00 | Pakistani Lawn | [Link üîó](https://yourdomain.myshopify.com/94xxxxxx32ecd064) | verified     | sent       |


## Important Notes
- **Phone Number Validation:** Ensure customer phone numbers are WhatsApp-enabled and formatted properly  
- **API Rate Limits:** Respect your WhatsApp provider‚Äôs API limits to avoid throttling  
- **Data Privacy:** Always comply with privacy laws when messaging customers  
- **Error Handling:** Monitor logs regularly to handle failed message deliveries  
- **Testing:** Test thoroughly with dummy data before activating the workflow live  


## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)

## Support & Help
- **WhatsApp**: [Chat on WhatsApp](https://wa.me/8801322827799)
- **Discord**: [SpaGreen Community](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)
- **Facebook Group**: [SpaGreen Support](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)
- **Website**: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)
- **Developer Portfolio**: [Codecanyon SpaGreen](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

parameters.content:
# Send WhatsApp Apology & Reorder Link When Shopify Order is Cancelled

## Overview
This **n8n workflow** listens for order cancellations in Shopify, extracts relevant customer and order data, checks if the customer‚Äôs phone number is registered on WhatsApp via the **Rapiwa API**, and sends a personalized apology message with a re-order link. It also logs successful and unsuccessful attempts in **Google Sheets** for tracking.


## Features
- Automatically detects cancelled orders via Shopify webhook.
- Extracts customer data including name, email, phone, order details, and shipping address.
- Cleans the phone number and converts it to WhatsApp-compatible format.
- Verifies if the phone number is registered on WhatsApp using Rapiwa API.
- Sends an apology message with a re-order link if the number is valid.
- Logs both verified/sent and unverified/not sent entries in Google Sheets.
- Rate limiting is controlled using `Wait` and `SplitInBatches` nodes.

## Requirements
- A Shopify store with order cancellation webhook enabled.
- A Rapiwa account and API token.
- An n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted).
- Google Sheet set up to log message statuses.
- Shopify Access Token (Private App or Admin API).
- Verified Rapiwa WhatsApp number and message credits.


## Google Sheet Required Columns
You‚Äôll need two Google Sheets (or two tabs in one spreadsheet):
**A Google Sheet formatted like this** ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12zMJod9s3Ov0RZh-7-ZoqTvJr4yMIqOeAQKTBeZlrRk/edit?usp=sharing)

## Nodes Used in the Workflow
- **Shopify Trigger** (`orders/cancelled`)
- **SplitInBatches**
- **Code** (Simplify order data)
- **Code** (Clean WhatsApp Number)
- **HTTP Request** (Verify via Rapiwa)
- **IF Node** (Check Rapiwa result)
- **HTTP Request** (Send Message via Rapiwa)
- **Google Sheets** (Append logs - verified)
- **Google Sheets** (Append logs - unverified)
- **Wait** (to control request flow)


## Notes & Warnings
- The `IF` node checks for `data.exists === true` to verify WhatsApp number status ‚Äî adjust if the API changes.
- Make sure **Rapiwa API rate limits** are respected to avoid temporary bans.
- Number formatting must strip non-digits and use the correct country code (e.g., `88017xxxxxxx`).
- Double-check message templates to avoid policy violations on WhatsApp Business.
- Be careful with customer privacy. Ensure compliance with **GDPR** or your local laws.


## Useful Links
- **Dashboard:** [https://app.rapiwa.com](https://app.rapiwa.com/login)
- **Official Website:** [https://rapiwa.com](https://rapiwa.com/)
- **Documentation:** [https://docs.rapiwa.com](https://docs.rapiwa.com/)

## Support & Help
- **WhatsApp**: [Chat on WhatsApp](https://wa.me/8801322827799)
- **Discord**: [SpaGreen Community](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)
- **Facebook Group**: [SpaGreen Support](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)
- **Website**: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)
- **Developer Portfolio**: [Codecanyon SpaGreen](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

## Shopify Trigger (Order Cancelled)
**Purpose:** Starts the workflow whenever an order is cancelled in Shopify  
**How it works:**  
- Listens to the Shopify webhook for order cancellation events  
- Automatically triggers the workflow on each cancellation  

## SplitInBatches
**Purpose:** Processes cancelled orders in manageable batches  

## Code (Simplify Order Data)
**Purpose:** Extracts and formats important customer and order details for later use  
**How it works:**  
- Parses the Shopify webhook data  
- Extracts customer name, phone, email, address, order total, order ID, and product details  
- Converts order total to a fixed decimal string

## Code (Clean WhatsApp Number)
**Purpose:** Formats and sanitizes the customer phone number for WhatsApp usage
**It works:** Removes all non-digit characters (spaces, dashes, parentheses)  

## HTTP Request (Check WhatsApp Number with Rapiwa)
**Purpose:** Verifies if the cleaned phone number is registered on WhatsApp using Rapiwa API
### How it works:
- Sends POST request to Rapiwa‚Äôs `/api/verify-whatsapp` endpoint  
- Uses Bearer token for authentication  
- **API Endpoint:** `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/verify-whatsapp`

## IF
**Purpose:** Routes the workflow depending on WhatsApp number verification result `verified` or `unverified` number


## HTTP Request (Send WhatsApp Message via Rapiwa)
**Purpose:** Sends a personalized WhatsApp apology message to verified customers
### How it works:
- Sends a POST request to Rapiwa‚Äôs `/api/send-message`  
- Uses Bearer token for authorization
**API Endpoint:** `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message`

## Google Sheets (Log Verified & Sent)
**Purpose:** Records details of customers successfully sent a WhatsApp message
### It works:
- Marks status as `"verified"` and `"sent"` Confirmation of row appended to Google Sheet


## Google Sheets (Log Unverified & Not Sent)
**Purpose:** Records details of customers whose WhatsApp numbers were not verified
### It works:
- Appends a row with customer and order details  
- Marks status as `"unverified"` and `"not sent"` Confirmation of row appended to Google Sheet

## How to Use This Workflow
### Step 1: Set Up Credentials
Add **Shopify**, **Google Sheets OAuth2**, and **Rapiwa Token** credentials in n8n.

### Step 2: Prepare Google Sheet
- Create a new Google Sheet with the columns listed above.
- Connect it inside the two Google Sheets nodes in the workflow.

### Step 3: Import Workflow
- Use **Import JSON** in n8n to load this complete automation.
- Make sure all credential references match your system.

### Step 4: Customize Message
- Edit the **Send Message Using Rapiwa** node to personalize your apology message  
  or localize it by language or product.

user.bio:
Simple, Reliable, Cost-Effective WhatsApp API
Rapiwa is a fast, reliable WhatsApp Business API Solution built for developers. Manage multiple sessions, scale your messaging, and enjoy transparent pricing with no per-message fees.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
